isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY CS-130 SERIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - POSITIVE AND NEGATIVE CHARGING CIRCUIT TEST

svcproc.title: POSITIVE AND NEGATIVE CHARGING CIRCUIT TEST

step1.para: Connect a voltmeter from the alternator output (BAT) terminal to battery positive terminal ( Figure 5, Step 1), (you may need a jumper wire to extend your voltmeter leads).
Load charging system with carbon pile to obtain 100 amps of current. Record the positive (+) voltage drop reading on the voltmeter. Turn carbon pile off.

Connect voltmeter leads from the alternator case to battery ground ( Figure 5, Step 3). Set voltmeter on low scale to read 1 - 2 volts. Load charging system with carbon pile to obtain 100 amps of current. Record negative (-) voltage drop in ground circuit between alternator housing and battery ground. Turn carbon pile off.

The total (sum) voltage of the two readings (steps 2 and 3) must be less than 1 volt. If the total (sum) of the two readings is greater than 1 volt, check system wiring and grounds. Repair as necessary. Rerun test steps 2 and 3 to verify system is repaired.
